content.description:
After Laocoön’s Death

At gemini lapsu delubradelubrum, -i, n. = templum, -i ad summa draconesdraco, -onis, m.: snake 
effugiunteffugio, -ere = fugio, -ere saevaeque petunt TritonidisTritonis, -idis, f.: Minerva arcem, 
sub pedibusque deae clipeique sub orbe teguntur. 
Tum vero tremefactatremefactus, -a, -um, adj.: trembling novus per pectora cunctis 

insinuatinsinuo, -are = intro, -are pavorpavor, -is, m. = timor, -is, et scelus expendisseexpendo, -ere, -i: to pay for merentem 
LaocoöntaLaocoönta = acc. sing. ferunt. 

Aeneid 2.225-230
content.question: Translate the passage as literally as possible.

frqParts.text: Translate the passage as literally as possible.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
